intro: Enarthrocarpus arcuatus var. anatolicus, commonly known as the Anatolian holly, is a shrub or small tree native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, blackish berries. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid climates. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a leathery texture, while its flowers are small and inconspicuous. This variety is notable for its ornamental value and resilience in harsh environments.
